boardgame.name: Rolling Heights: Bonus Mini Game
boardgame.description:
Big Cities have a way of attracting Big Problems!

The newly built city of Rolling Heights is being attacked by a giant creature! Will the defenders of Rolling Heights capture the beast before it destroys the city?

Find out with the 3-5minute bonus mini-game included with all Kickstarter pledges! One player takes the role of the beast trying to destroy the city by knocking over the building. The other players are the defenders of the city and try to capture the beast before all is lost.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rolling Heights: Bonus Building Tiles
boardgame.description:
Rolling Heights: Bonus Building Tiles includes the following

(5) John D Clair Bonus Building Tiles
Each of these 5 bonus buildings are themed after one of AEG's other games that John D Clair designed.

(5) Waterfront Properties
Location Location Location! The most valuable land in a city tends to near the waterfront, and this series of buildings is designed to take full advantage of those locations

boardgame.name: The Pacific War: Deadly Bloody Battles of Combined Fleet
太平洋戦争: 血戦!!連合艦隊
boardgame.description:
Strategic level wargame based on World War 2 Pacific theater. The basic game engine is inspired from Taiheiki.

Units represent admirals of Imperial Japan or Allied Nations, and their naval and air strength.

In each turn, players roll die for initiative, and then move admirals alternately by initiative .
Battles, control of sea zone and replacement are affected by admiral's abilities.

Victory points that determine the winner of the game are mainly obtained by controlling 14 sea areas, and also from the killed in action of enemy admirals.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups

listing.notes: New. Not used. Including english translation of rules. Banzai Magazine vol. 12 included.

boardgame.name: The London Pub Crawl
boardgame.description:
The London Pub Crawl is easy to pick-up-and-play so that new and old friends can join in quickly. The game board has includes a simplified set of the rules for those more forgetful pub crawlers...


Start the Crawl - Roll the die to discover where you start on the game board and pull your first Pub Card.
How to Crawl - Start each turn by pulling a Crawl Card, read it aloud and play the action on the back.
Where to Crawl - Then roll the die and take any path you wish to reach the location on your Pub Card.
Crawl to Victory - when you reach your first Pub, draw your next Pub Card and continue playing until you become the first player to reach three pubs and declare *burp* victory!


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wicked Apples: Hexed
boardgame.description: The Wicked Apples: Hexed expansion adds 4 new apples (Charmed, Wickedest, Squished, and Sour) to expand the deck to 32 apples.

boardgame.name: Shaking Sunflower
boardgame.description: The game consist of a shaking sunflower that is dancing during the game to make the players' task more difficult. Each player has their own set of marbles which they shall place on the sunflower's flowers. The first player to place all their marbles is the winner.

boardgame.name: Wicked Apples: Grim
boardgame.description: The Wicked Apples: Grim expansion adds 4 new apples (Telekinetic Apple, Apthulu Apple, Shadow Apple, and Cursed Apple) which can be swapped with apples from the original deck to change up the game.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Storm Ground - Spoils of War Weapon Pack
boardgame.description:
Given away with order from Games Workshop in the month of the games release and the release of the 3rd Edition of Age of Sigmar, this gets you weapons for the Maggotkin, Stormcast and Nighthaunt.

Can be equipped on any hero to expand your army choices.

Now available for purchase separately

User Submission
boardgame.videogameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Storm Ground

boardgame.name: Unlikely Heroes: Archaic Beginnings Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Archaic Beginnings Expansion is a fun addition to the three core boxes: Vikings, Pharaohs, or Cowboys. In the Expansion box, you find Weather, Nightfall, and Epic that each in their way adds exiting mechanisms or extra adventuring quests to the mix.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map.

As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.

boardgame.name: The Fully Automated Board Game
boardgame.description:
The Fully Automated Board Game is a fast party game based on robots, unionism, and achieving full automation. The game is for 2 to 10 players and features elements of diplomacy, bluffing, and a pinch of Luddism.

In The Fully Automated Board Game you will be able to play the role of a proud worker or a corrupt boss. The goal of the workers, who play semi-cooperatively, is to expropriate as many robots as possible. The objective of the two bosses, competing both with the workers and with each other, is to accumulate lots of money!

Each turn of the game is developed in seven phases and represents one month of work. During the month, bosses can hire workers or build obedient robots. On the other hand, workers are not obliged to accept jobs and can even go on strike, bearing in mind that at the end of the month they may no longer have the money to pay the rent.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 51st State: Ultimate Edition – Gamefound expansions
boardgame.description:
51st State: Ultimate Edition is the all-in-one package for 51st State, including the base game as well as six expansions: New Era, Winter, Scavengers, Allies, Moloch, and No Man's Land.

This expansion features all of the mini-expansions and promos released prior to 2022, component upgrades, and a fictional story set in the Neuroshima world. In more detail, with this expansion, you have eight factions available for play instead of four, a dedicated neoprene playmat for the No Man's Land expansion, engraved wooden markers, and many promos that expand the game even more.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: 51st State: Master Set – Border Tiles Promo
51st State: Master Set – Mississippi & University Factions
51st State: Master Set – Texas and Hegemony Factions
51st State: Master Set – Three Cities Mini Expansion

boardgame.name: Co na to Češi?
boardgame.description: Board game for two teams of players, where they compete and try to guess and answer to question. Answers were submitted by Czech people and players try to guess, what the people answered the most.

boardgame.name: The Helm of Radiance (WWN)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover the mystery of the Helm of Radiance!

The Helm of Radiance is a 6 page drop-in adventure for Worlds Without Number that can be used in most fantasy settings for 1st level characters. The Helm of Radiance can be used in your campaigns, or as a 1-2 hour one-shot adventure.

The Helm of Radiance includes:

Explore the Cave of Whispers, a reportedly haunted locale.
Solve a riddle of incredible danger.
Solve the mystery of The Helm of Radiance with several possible player determined outcomes!
A new WWN monster!

boardgame.name: Mimic Tamers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mimic Tamers RPG supplement includes short stories and new mimic ideas and adventure hooks. Includes variant mimic creatures (mimic spellbook, mimic wagon, mimic inn, and others). Includes the Mimic tamer ranger subclass. 5E Compatible.

boardgame.name: Maps for Fantasy RPGs III
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Laidback DM's Maps for Fantasy RPGs 3 is a collection of 20 hand-drawn, full color maps (2 zip files, totalling 100 digital image files, in CMYK Print format, RGB Screen format, full size A3 & A4 grid and grid-less and grid-less VTT size). These maps come with a limited commercial license allowing you, the purchaser, to use them royalty-free in your own commercial or private publication projects.

Dungeons, mines, temples, ruins, lairs, tombs, fey wilderness and more! All map images are high quality 600DPI (print quality is 300DPI) full color JPEGS and are unlabeled, so you can add your own as needed.

These maps are system-neutral and can be used with any fantasy game.

boardgame.name: Akashic Spheres Unleashed
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Akashic Spheres Unleashed combines all of Studio M—'s previously published content combining Spheres and Akasha alongside a swathe of brand new content for this book! This book contains content expanding on Spheres of Akasha, as well as "traditional" Akashic options as well!

Contained within this book are 95 pages of content including:

New Spheres of Might, Spheres of Power, and Champions of the Spheres content for every Akashic Class published up to this point!
New Akashic content for nearly every Spheres class!
New talent-based magic item creation rules for the Veilweaving sphere!
Brand new Sphereshaper veils, now including a Sphereshaper veil for every single first-party Sphere!

boardgame.name: Twinkle: Kickstarter exclusives
boardgame.description:
A pack of 24 extra cards given to backers of the Twinkle Kickstarter campaign.

The pack includes 14 new event cards and 10 new mission cards.

boardgame.name: Shaar: Motley Lands Massacre
boardgame.description:
Shaar: Motley Lands Massacre board game is a progressive, interactive game, of which the game plot is determined according to the main scenario. Players will take on the role of legendary heroes with their own special set of animals, holy trees and they will choose their own path for traveling through the magical universe of Shaar.

At the start of the game, each player chooses a character, tree, and animal card. The player then chooses a path to take. They select a card (event, item, or road card) based on their current location and tour. Players roll dice to accomplish certain goals and events, as well as to determine who wins battles and duels, during gameplay. Finally, the game progresses along the road with the player's character growth, finishing in victory by fighting the endgame bosses.

The ultimate achievement in the game is to first destroy the enemy elements by reaching the campsites located at the end of the city routes to be determined and then to gain a victory by destroying endgame bosses. Besides the main mission, there are many sub-duties within the game. The sub-duties, which are shaped through the edicts and road cards individuated according to cities, directly affect the development of the player’s character and animal; also, it enables the player to reach a lot of opportunities.

boardgame.name: Race to Stupid
boardgame.description:
"The party trivia game where you can outsmart the smartie pants with the stupidest answers and win the game."

The judge reads a question from a card, and all other players write down two answers - their best guess at the "real answer" and then their funniest "stupid answer".

A correct real answer gets 1 point, but the funniest "stupid answer" (as decided by the judge) gets 2 points.

Play in rounds, so everyone has the same number of turns to be the judge. Tally up points at the end of the game.

listing.notes: The best new trivia game where you dont need to know the answers to win. Trivia With A Fun Twist: Race to Stupid was made with just one thing in mind – Fun! With 400 fun trivia questions, 6 dry erase markers and 6 dry erase answer cards this trivia game will let you unleash your inner stupid in the most hilarious ways Anybody Can Win: Race to Stupid is just the right game for teens and adults that aren’t afraid to get creative. Players answer interesting trivia questions in two ways. The right way and the stupid way. The right answer is worth 1 point and the stupid answer is worth 2 points Suitable For Every Occasion: This fun card game with trivia questions provides the perfect fit for entertaining friends and family on any occasion including family game nights, beach trips, camping trips, road trips, drinking parties, etc. Simple to Play: Understanding and playing this trivia game is simple for both teens and adults. There are no complex rules to follow and the one with the funniest answer wins – that’s it! Each session can last up to 45 minutes and is suitable for 2 – 6 players Make It A Gift: Besides being the perfect way to spend time with family and friends the fun way, Race to Stupid adult party game also makes a fun and unique gift for Christmas, Thanksgiving, Birthdays, New Year’s, Anniversaries, and more

boardgame.name: Tales are Real: Animalis vs. Schatten
boardgame.description:
A fantasy dueling card game with easy to learn rules and intuitive game mechanics.

In Tales are Real, two player fight with creature cards against each other. Each player has five creatures on the table and can equip them with item cards to make them mir powerful. On every turn, both player choose one of their creatures for battle. The creatures fight against each other and deal damage to each other. The damage depends on the creatures basic strength and equipment. Creature cards has special abilities to avoid or reduce damage. To activate the ability players has to roll the dice.

The goal of Tales are Real is to destroy as many creatures of your opponent as possible. The player who lost the most creature cards within five rounds, loses the game.

boardgame.name: Reality Alteration
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Volume 17 of Awesome Powers deals with the incredible abilities of Reality Alteration. Reality Alteration is arguably one of the most potent of Power Suites, as it allows the wielder to shape reality like a sculptor does clay. One thing that sets the Reality Alteration Suite apart is that in addition to Offensive, Defensive, and Utility Types, Reality Alteration powers have a fourth type: Cosmic. All Cosmic-Scale powers are within the Reality Alteration Suite, and there are some new ones here as well that have been designed to work specifically with the Power Suites system.

boardgame.name: Six Greetings Card Games
boardgame.description:
Six games entirely contained within greetings cards.

The game board is the front of the card, with the rules on the reverse. On the back, cut off the component section and flip out the player aid and you're ready to play! When you're finished, use the envelope as a game box.

The games are inspired by classic board games, but re-imagined with a hobby gaming lens. Various mechanics, player counts and complexity...

A closer look at the six games:

Splinter: A resource management, paper-cutting party game (3-8 players)
Enemy Lines: A head-to-head strategy game (2 players)
Guess How: A cooperative legacy game (1-4 players)
In the Dining Room with the Hatchet: A cut-throat programming game (3-6 players)
Snakes, Ladders and a Pogo Stick: A worker placement racing game (3-5 players)
Another Life: An economic action selection game (2-4 players)


These are big games in small formats.
Give a card that's also a game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bimini
boardgame.description:
The players take turns placing a tile on the game board. New tiles must be placed side by side with tiles already placed, thereby only connecting areas of the same shade (light or dark blue).

The players get points awarded for each placed tile. When all tiles are placed or the remaining tiles can't be placed, the player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Upsetting the Balance
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“From the Record of Battle: It has been two weeks since we set out from Outpost Victory 357 at the edge of the Triangle for our patrol. Aside from the occasional nebula and other stellar phenomena – which we have cataloged dutifully – there has been little to stimulate the crew. They are keeping themselves as sharp as they can, but when a d’k tahg sits unused for too long, it becomes dull. I am hoping our fortunes change soon.”

This 17-page PDF adventure for the Star Trek Adventures Roleplaying Game is written by Troy Mepyans, and is set during The Next Generation era with the player characters being the crew of a Klingon ship. This adventure also contains advice on adaptation for use in campaigns based in other Star Trek eras.

boardgame.name: Rot tabu
boardgame.description:
The players place 6 tiles (1-6) white side up on the lower row of their tableau. Then the players take turns rolling the die. After each roll the player may take the white tile with the rolled number from the tableau of his right neighbor and places it red side up on the upper row of his own tableau if he has the complimentary white tile on his lower row. If not he places it white side up on his lower row. If a player already has both tiles, the new tile is placed white side up on his own white tile. Red tiles are safe and may never be taken.

If A player has at least 4 red tiles he may take white tiles from any player. If a player has only one white tile left, and has not the corresponding red tile he may place the tile red side up on his upper row without rolling a die.

The first player with 6 red tiles wins the game.

Rule printed inside box cover.

boardgame.name: Anachrony: Basically Wooden Insert
boardgame.description:
Designed with the Kickstarter version, our Anachrony organiser will take everything this huge game has to offer!
The main board and the player boards lie neatly on top of the organiser and there is approx 8mm lid lift when the box is closed.

Our organiser is flat packed ready for assembly - all you need is a sharp knife, PVA wood glue and a little patience. Simple assembly instructions showing step by step photos with hints and tips makes putting it together a breeze!

Every component has it’s own section and the box containing the Exosuits has a lid to protect them - especially if you paint your minis - each Exosuit has a recess in the box so that none of them touch each other.
The organiser comes with each section etched with the name of the component making setup and break down quick and easy.

This is a BIG organiser!

~Taken from Basically Wooden's Etsy page

boardgame.name: Foray Into the Flow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After proving themselves as heroes, your party is once again called upon to handle a problem. This one gets you dirty as you must descend into the sewers to find a wanted criminal!

Although set in the Margou Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for four, second level adventurers.

boardgame.name: Skin and Bone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The stinger of a Wyvern. The tail of a Manticore. The heart of the Rakshasa. A certain gland from a ghoul.
Monsters have special powers, it’s true. WIth a deft hand and a sharp blade, however, you can even the score. The poisonous stinger of that Wyvern you just killed shouldn’t go to waste, right? What about the pelt of a winter wolf? These things have power – if you know how to harness it.
Skin and Bones provides sixteen different useful pieces of monsters you can harvest. It runs the gamut from pelts to singers to internal organs. We all know your medicine skill isn’t getting rolled enough. We can help with that. Each entry details one particular item as well as how to get it and a little flavor to inject it into your campaign with.

boardgame.name: The Maze of Mezeria (Mythras)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Brave the Maze of Mezeria! There is but one chance for glory, but many for death. Venture forth with skill and guile or join the doom of a long dead civilization. The Maze of Mezeria is a 62-page adventure for Mythras. Your players will explore a labyrinth full of secrets while fighting for their very survival. The Mythras Core Rulebook is required for this adventure.

In this adventure you will find;

A 62-page adventure that should last 10-20 hours depending on playstyle;
A fully keyed map of the Maze of Mezeria;
New adversaries, including Blobs, Cannibals, and more;
A full adventure summary, keyed for quick reference at the table;

boardgame.name: The Stars Will Not Break Me
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

CONTENT WARNING: THIS PRODUCT CONTAINS MENTIONS OF SELF HARM, DRUG USE AND SUICIDE

It's hard out there, in the great nowhere. "No one will hear you scream" stops being a throwaway gag once you're out in the void and the closest thing to your ship is several lifetimes away.

Time in space takes a toll on you, and sometimes, you're going to travel places meant for no one to see, things will get violent, people will die, and that will slowly make your life harder.

Trauma is no joke.

Trauma and mental illness are things I, the author, as a person, have to deal with, every day.

One day, it might even get me.

But that day hasn't come yet, and it's why I play games where I can vicariously experience other people dealing with the same shit that I do, and triumphing anyway.

Today, I bring you a modification of the rules for panic effects in Mothership that put the emphasis on player choice: instead of losing control, your character will find ways to cope.

These ways to cope might not be healthy, but they help stay somewhat sane. They will make it easier to not run away screaming, but at a cost. Perhaps you'll punish your body, perhaps you'll start retreating behind a wall of silence, perhaps you'll grow hateful and abusive, but at least, you'll be functional. Sometimes.

These mechanics put your character in complete control of how they deal with the trauma they get saddled with: your character will never go berserk unless you make them. The idea is to make rules that encourage roleplaying trauma without forcing you to, because I find that it makes it harder to feel something when a game just tells you to feel it.

This add on also comes with fun additionnal drugs, including some specifically made for androids, and an adventure location for cheap stress relief at a terrible cost.

boardgame.name: The Fire Caller
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Sorcerer sub-class for 5E that helps you fully realize your pyromantic dreams. You can burn your own life force like a candle to fuel your fire spells, and this soul empowered fire cuts through resistance and immunity.

boardgame.name: Game Of Pawns: Iron Cauldron
boardgame.description:
Game of Pawns: Iron Cauldron gives you the opportunity to become king Izanoff and save the holy city of Argenost from King Horvat the Horrible. Lead a bunch of misfits from the infamous 2nd Infantry Izanoff Regiment against the powerful and dreaded Horvatian Army in the Battle of the Iron Cauldron.

In this two-player chess-like game, players can switch sides for the Second Battle of the Iron Cauldron for a purely unique battle experience. The invading Horvatian Army units can receive promotions while 2nd Infantry Izanoff Regiment can receive reinforcements from the city of Argenost. In the third and final battle, 2nd Infantry faces off against King Horvat's elite Wolf Guard Regiment in an epic game of pawns.

To win the game, you capture or trap your opponent's king or they are forced to surrender. The game ends with a draw if capturing the king becomes futile for either side.

Each player takes turns moving a unit towards the enemy based on their unit's movement/attack ability, to gain ground, capture enemy pieces, set traps, enforce area denial or perform counteroffensive operations.

Get Ready: War is Coming!

boardgame.name: Treasure of Nadia
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Calling it an adventure may be a stretch, though onre reviewer called it "the Tomb Raider you've been waiting for". The protagonist is a male who, by playing a number of mini-games and solving puzzles, advances the story. He does this with the help of a number of a number of good looking and big breasted ladies which are rated for Wisdom, Social Energy, Sex Drive, Toughness and Friendliness.
You're a sort of mix of 007 James Bond and Indiana Jones (Raider of the Lost Arc), hunting for treasure and boning every female in the story while doing that.
The game prides itself on 2500 animated scenes, most "naughty ones". The game has a lot of explicit scenes - well, hardcore porn, actually.

Treasure of Nadia features

A compelling story
2500+ animations
Collectible Kamasutra pages
A huge world map to discover
Engaging mini-games


And much more!
boardgame.videogameseries: Lust Epidemic and Treasure of Nadia story

boardgame.name: Lust Epidemic
boardgame.description:
User Summary

You play a student named Brad. You find yourself in a hurricane and take shelter in the Saint Dame University. You'll explore the ancient and creepy campus grounds and uncover many secrets... s well as some sexy fun!
You'll find items and clues that'll solve the mysteries and you'll build your relationships with the woman you find yourself trapped with.

The game is point & click and rewards the player with explicit porn scenes
boardgame.videogameseries: Lust Epidemic and Treasure of Nadia story

boardgame.name: The Management Game
boardgame.description: The first known business video game. Its purpose was to help prepare students to be management executives. It simulated a market battle between 3 companies over a period of 3 years. Playing time is approximately 2 semesters.

boardgame.name: Monumental Consequence
boardgame.description:
A role-play based negotiation game where players take the roles of townsfolk who must determine whether to save their local church and its relics.

In Monumental Consequence, players are the villages in the town of La Ville, whose church has been taken over by an invading army. Do you risk your lives to attack the church to save the art or bomb it?

Similar to social deduction games, each player has a designated role and win conditions associated with it. Players negotiate and vote to make the choice. if the vote is inconclusive, a dice rolling mechanic is used to complicate the scenario and start a new round.

Play continues until one side has enough votes. Then a final dice determines the winner and the consequences of the choice.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Center for Learning Through Games and Simulations

boardgame.name: Castles by the Sea
boardgame.description:
Castles by the Sea is a puzzly sandcastle-building game for 1-4 players. As a group of tiny folk called "shorelings," your goal is to build and populate a seaside kingdom.

Each turn, you'll place blocks and meeples on the map to earn victory points. The core gameplay is similar to abstract strategy games like Santorini, in that players must optimize three-dimensional placement on a shared grid.

Hazards are the only source of randomness in the game, and even those depend on player choices. Each turn, you must choose your placement carefully, optimizing your score while interfering with your opponents' plans.

The game ends after a set number of turns. Few castles will remain standing after a final onslaught of hazards, but the the kingdom with the most sand dollars can claim victory.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Flip That House The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Flip That House The Board Game takes its players through the journey of real estate investing, also known today as "house flipping". The first "flipper" to acquire one million dollars in cash and property, is declared the Ultimate Flipping Mogul.

Flippers begin with $250,000 in cash and a flip. The flipper that rolls the highest number on the dice begin play and then clock wise for the next flippers turn. Flippers roll dice and move the appropriate spaces on the colorful and bright game board, following the action on the spot in which they landed.

This game will provide hours of fun and education for groups of all ages.

boardgame.name: Larry Correia's Monster Hunter International the Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
Publishers' blurb:

MHI NEEDS YOU!

Join up with Monster Hunter International, the monster hunting professionals of Larry Correia’s New York Times bestselling series! This book contains updated information about the world of Monster Hunter International, including allies, foes, enemies and targets, the latest and most up-to-date PUFF table out there, as well as full rules for playing as any of the myriad of professional hunting teams in the MHI World!

So what are you waiting for? Cowboy up, and get paid!

This book requires the Savage Worlds Deluxe rulebook to be played.

boardgame.name: Manifest Destiny
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Across the East Coast, humanity continues to reassert itself. Step by painful step, it has dragged itself from the darkness. For the first time in generations, people look upon the wastes and the ruins of old America; not with fear or despair, but with precarious hope.

With the America of old destroyed, only spectres of the world that came before remain. A wind of change is stirring, and a new world is beginning to coalesce. Yet as foreign influence spreads across the continent and a civil war fuelled by the outrages of slavery looms, those who remember the America of old ask themselves; Are these times truly a chance for a new beginning, or is America doomed to repeat the sins of its past foundations?

boardgame.name: Locus Player Guide
boardgame.description:
A Roleplaying Game of Personal Horror and Mystery

From the introduction:

Locus is a tabletop roleplaying system with a focus on personal horror, one which explores themes of guilt, morality, and mystery. Our aim in creating this game was to explore the nature of fear, tension, and stress, and to give Players the means to experience those emotions through their Characters. This game is designed to facilitate the experience of overcoming and combatting that fear in order to survive.

One member of the group will take on the role of the Director — our term for ‘game master’ — and the rest become the Players, or the Cast. We recommend that Locus be played with anywhere between two and eight people. We have found that a group size of four or five works best.

boardgame.name: Locus Director's Guide
boardgame.description:
A Roleplaying Game of Personal Horror and Mystery

From the introduction:

Locus is a tabletop roleplaying system with a focus on personal horror, one which explores themes of guilt, morality, and mystery. Our aim in creating this game was to explore the nature of fear, tension, and stress, and to give Players the means to experience those emotions through their Characters. This game is designed to facilitate the experience of overcoming and combatting that fear in order to survive.

One member of the group will take on the role of the Director — our term for ‘game master’ — and the rest become the Players, or the Cast. We recommend that Locus be played with anywhere between two and eight people. We have found that a group size of four or five works best.

User summary:

A "core book printing pages" separate PDF is available, containing the fourteen print-and-play pages on a printer-friendly background.

boardgame.name: A Compendium of Curious Curiosities
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Murder! Daggerford is haunted by grisly murders as residents of this simple town are found dead and faceless. What horror awaits adventurers as they attempt to solve this mysterious crime?
A 4-Hour Wild Beyond the Witchlight Dungeoncraft Adventure for Tier 2 Characters optimized for player level 8 .

Content Warning: Mutilation, Body Horror
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Scion of Darkness
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The island of Kiru is visible in the distance, and within the jungles that blanket it, the temple that you seek. The jungle doesn’t rest, however, and neither should you; with death fast on your heels, you must set off in pursuit of your quarry.

The eleventh adventure in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures.

An adventure for 7th level characters.

CONTENT WARNING: horror, gore (blood, dismemberment, impalement), oppression (xenophobia, genocide, humanoid hunting, being hunted, ritualistic murder), murder, self-harm, abuse (forced amputation, optional possession, threats, intimidation), environmental hazards (jungle), possible phobia triggers (insects, snakes, leeches).

boardgame.name: Heads Up!: Adult Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
The Heads Up! Adult Expansion Pack with 200 all-new cards works with any version of the popular party game, Heads Up!. While Heads Up! is a fun family game, the Heads Up! Adult Expansion Pack is something to whip out at your next adult party.

Four racy categories include Adult Supervision (1), Adult Supervision 2: Even Adultier, Adult Supervision 3: Bad Behavior, and Adult Supervision 4: Bachelorette Party. In the Adult Supervision (1 & 2) and Bachelorette Party categories, you guess words based on verbal clues. In the Bad Behavior category, you act out words for your teammate to guess. How would you act out Mud Wrestling, Pole Dance, or Sobriety Test? Those are just a few examples of what we can safely mention here.

Race the timer to guess the adult words you're wearing on your headband, based on your teammate's verbal clues. Or watch them act out the words and guess the answers before time's up!

The Heads Up! Adult Expansion Pack is a salacious supplement to the Heads Up! Game (sold separately). With 200 new cards (the same amount as in the original game), it's a whole new game that adults only are invited to play!

--publisher's description
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Adult Versions of Family-Friendly Games

boardgame.name: Kooky Cats
boardgame.description:
Kooky Cats is a cat collecting card game featuring over 50 quirky and close-knit cats brought to life by Jean Jullien in his second collaboration with us ? It’s a bit like Happy Families meets Go Fish, but where all the fish have been eaten by cats, and instead of being happy, the families are all a bit bonkers.

The game features twelve groups, or Cat-egories as we like to call them, each consisting of four cats with the same distinguishing features. To win, you want to collect the most complete Cat-egories before the game ends. However with Special Cards and Kooky Tokens thrown in the mix, things might not always go to plan.

As well as twelve Cat-egories, the game features seven stupendous Special Cards, twelve Kooky Tokens, and the game changing, face-shifting The Cat That Got The Cream Card. The Special Cards consist of Catnap, Back'cat You!, Cat's Got My Tongue, the Catfish, and of course the Dodgy Dog – each with the ability to turn the game upside down!

boardgame.name: Singö
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Singö - A Few Days in the Countryside is a solo journaling game about spending a few days in a cottage in the countryside. It is a game about spending a few days in the intersection of your past and your present. It is a game about weather, and nature, and memories of your childhood. And maybe trolls.

boardgame.name: Think: Logo Cards
boardgame.description:
70 cards with puzzles in three difficulty stages that are to be solved using logic, fantasy and an eye for details. Points can be scored upon solving the puzzle depending on difficulty, and some extra points when answering a surprise extra question regarding details in the picture. Solution and explanation are provided on the back of the picture cards. Every card is a single puzzle only.

Description from the publisher:
"Lösen Sie knifflige Bilderrätsel. Allein mit Logik und Fantasie." ("Solve challenging picture puzzles with logic and fantasy alone.")

boardgame.name: Tank Mechanic Simulator - First Supply DLC
boardgame.description:
https://twitter.com/_Degenerals/status/1486700864354013192

User Summary

A new DLC which brings five new armored vehicles to the default Tank Mechanic Simulator experience, including:
- BT-7 (Early 1935)
- M18 Hellcat
- IS-2
- Churchill Mk III AVRE
- PzKpfw VI Ausf. B Tiger II (H) “King Tiger”

boardgame.name: Wheatford Court Castle
boardgame.description: A storytelling game based in a mysterious castle. There are three variations on the rules: In the Explore the castle variation, players take turns contributing to the story using the cards in hand; In the discover the secrets variation, players aren't offered the choice; in the investigate the mystery variation, one player is the perpetrator of the crime, and the story is structured around that.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Dominion
boardgame.description:
A Warhammer Age of Sigmar boxed set with two sizable armies – including all-new units and even a never-before-seen subfaction of the Orruk Warclans – a copy of the updated Warhammer Age of Sigmar Core Book with exclusive full-art cover, and more.

Dominion includes a mighty Lord-Imperatant with accompanying Gryph-hound, a spell-casting Knight-Arcanum, a Knight-Vexillor with Banner of Apotheosis, three each of the elite Praetors and Annihilators, and 10 Vindictors. Not only that, but it includes the huntress supreme, Yndrasta, the Celestial Spear – a legendary hero of the Stormcast Eternals whose knowledge of Ghur, the Realm of Beasts, is second to none.

Meanwhile, the Kruleboyz of the Thondian swamplands are a malicious, spiteful breed of orruks whose presence has, until recently, been shrouded by the cloying mists of their home. Despite being new to the setting, the Kruleboyz can fight alone as an army in their own right or alongside any of the other forces from the Orruk Warclans. Dominion includes a pair of hulking Killabosses – one riding a Great Gnashtoof, and the other accompanied by a Stab-grot – a Swampcalla Shaman and Pot-grot minion, a Murknob with Belcha-banna, three Man-skewer Boltboyz, 10 murderous Gutrippaz and 20 sneaky Hobgrot Slittaz.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vier Königreiche
boardgame.description:
For many centuries there was peace in the four great kingdoms and life in the lands was simple and carefree. One day, however, unfriendly and warlike tribes appeared from the lands beyond the horizon and brought danger to the four kingdoms. The four rulers decided together to protect the people from the evil invaders and bring them into the cities. However, because the cities were too small and unsafe, they were first to be enlarged and expanded. Defensive towers, churches and a city wall were to be built around the stately palace, which was also to be newly erected. And so the great builders of the world were commissioned to plan and implement the buildings for the kingdom of the mountain lands in the north, the kingdom of the sun in the east, the desert kingdom in the south and the kingdom of the forest peoples in the west. In order to get all this done in time before a possible attack by the enemy tribes, the builders gather people from all walks of life - from peasants to princes - to help and cooperate from the lands. Each person is given his or her task, which must be completed exactly according to plan and order.

You and your fellow players slip into the role of these master builders. Everyone tries to place all their cards with the helping citizens on the building sites before all the other players. Act wisely and strategically as a master builder and you may become the greatest master builder of the four kingdoms...

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Das große Allgemeinwissen-Quiz
boardgame.description:
If anyone knows about general knowledge, it's him: The TV-famous "know-it-all" Sebastian Klussmann presents 300 entertaining questions, divided into the ten official knowledge categories of the German Quiz Championships.
After participating in this quiz, you are guaranteed to be smarter!

boardgame.name: Bargain Quest: Crochet familiar cat
boardgame.description:
A crochet version of the familiar cat from bargain quest

Replace 1st player token

boardgame.name: Das große Deutsch-Quiz
boardgame.description: Everything that makes the German language appealing is celebrated in this high-quality equipped quiz box! Lovers of language and literature can look forward to a variety of exciting questions and equally instructive and enlightening answers.

boardgame.name: Super Fantasy Brawl: The Sleeve Kit
boardgame.description: Contains 120 Standard Poker size Sleeves and 15 Mini-Poker size Sleeves

boardgame.name: Write on Track
boardgame.description:
In Write on Track, a new Train game, players will be connecting Cities, gaining influence, and increasing population all in a push to import and export goods. Each turn 2 six-sided dice are rolled and 1-100 players simultaneously complete actions using each of the dice. The player can mark Influence in an area of the map, which can gain them bonus abilities. The player can use the die value to fill in Population rings of a City to show its demand for Imported goods. The player can also use the value to connect two Cities in a matching region or to connect a City from that region to an adjacent City in another region.

Players will find plenty of ways to earn Stars in this Sandbox style game! Stars are used to trigger game end. Further, the game includes a 9 card expansion deck that allows for Campaign play as players open up new ways of earning Stars and the player who won a previous game starts with a bonus at the beginning of the next game, the losing players also receive a bonus to start the next game. Play a Campaign of 10 games and see who had the greatest total of Stars across the entire Campaign! The Campaign can also be played solo, can you get to 300 Stars?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Birds, Dragons and the Dungeon
Mågen Dragen & Kastellet
Måsen, Draken och Kastellet
boardgame.description:
The knights do their best to climb to the top of the castle, while taking care of flying seagulls, dragons and the daring knights of their opponents. Everyone wants to escape from the castle's scary dungeon! Which strategy do you choose - to focus on fast climbing to the top of the castle, or do you have time to stop to stop the competing knights with sweeping tricks? The player with the first knight who reaches the top of the castle wins the game.

Players take turns playing cards to get their knights to the top.

boardgame.name: Deeldo
boardgame.description:
When you play Deeldo, you have one and only mission: to create majestic, flamboyand Deeldoes.

Of course, there are some rules to follow. First things first, it's not about real toys. You have a card deck, where the three parts of which a Deeldo is made - a head, a body and a base - are depicted. You draw your initial hand, compose Deeldoes on the desk, and then wait for your friends while they do the same. Each turn, you draw two cards - and history repeats.

Deeldoes must start with a base, end with a head, and have at least a body part in it. There is no limit to the Deeldo composition - more the colors, more the fun, after all - but remember that there are combos that can bring you more points. Vibrating and studded Deeldoes give you more points, just like color-matching toys.

When a player has completed their 3rd Deeldo, or when cards are finished, the game is over. The player with the highest score wins, and gets the chance to start the following match. The one with the lower score, instead, wears the Crown of the Loser. It's the rules, baby.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pocket Quiz: Stadt, Land, Quiz
boardgame.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

This edition contains 150 surprising and curious questions about cities, countries, rivers, beaches, buildings, sights, national parks and other geographical facts. Amusement and amazement guaranteed!

The title translates to "city, country, quiz".

boardgame.name: Der rätselhafte Zauberwald
boardgame.description:
Der rätselhafte Zauberwald ("The enigmatic enchanted forest") is an escape game full of riddles and puzzles that consists only of cards.

The shortcut through the forest turns out to be a big mistake: the players suddenly find themselves in a magical clearing, surrounded by strange magical creatures.
To get out again, they have to elicit coded clues from the forest residents. Will they find the exit in time?

How to play:
The players are trapped in the mysterious enchanted forest and have to find their way out as quickly as possible.
To find their way out, they are dependent on the help of the forest inhabitants. These pose a riddle to the players each time before they reveal their knowledge.
The players must first solve all 17 riddles of the forest inhabitants to then master the last big riddle: Where is the exit from the mysterious enchanted forest?

By the way: The game material remains intact and can therefore be used again and again.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 60 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 12+
Der rätselhafte Zauberwald - Escape-Spiel Mit den Escape-Games aus dem moses. Verlag bringen Sie Rätselspaß in die eigenen vier Wände.
Die Abkürzung durch den Wald erweist sich als großer Fehler: Die Spieler*innen finden sich plötzlich auf einer magischen Lichtung wieder, inmitten von merkwürdigen Zauberwesen. Um wieder herauszukommen, müssen sie den Waldbewohnern verschlüsselte Hinweise entlocken. Finden sie rechtzeitig den Ausgang? Eine spannende Rätsel-Reise durch den Zauberwald beginnt!
Dieses handliche Escape-Game ist ein reines Kartenspiel und eignet sich perfekt für Einsteiger*innen, denn die auf den ersten Blick kleine Schachtel bietet riesengroßen Rätselspaß. Insgesamt 17 Rätsel müssen gelöst werden, bevor das letzte große Rätsel geknackt und der Ausgang aus dem Zauberwald gefunden werden kann. Anders als bei anderen Escape-Spielen bleibt das Spielmaterial hier übrigens unversehrt und ist so immer wieder verwendbar.
+ Escape-Spiel für zu Hause + Spielmaterial bleibt unversehrt– immer wieder verwendbar + kleine Schachtel, großer Rätselspaß
So wird’s gespielt: - Die Spieler*innen sind im rätselhaften Zauberwald gefangen und müssen schnellstmöglich wieder herausfinden. - Um den Ausweg zu finden, sind sie auf die Hilfe der Waldbewohner angewiesen. Diese stellen den Spieler*innen aber jedes Mal ein Rätsel, bevor sie ihr Wissen preisgeben. - So müssen die Spieler*innen erst die 17 Rätsel der Waldbewohner lösen, um dann das letzte große Rätsel zu bewältigen: Wo liegt der Ausgang aus dem rätselhaften Zauberwald?
Inhalt: 5 Transparentpapiere 88 Spielkarten
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

The game is new and still in shrink wrap!
I will ship from Germany and I am willing to ship anywhere.
Please ask me, for the shipping costs for your land.
I will charge shipping at cost. Everything will be well packed.
You can pay me through Paypal or bank transfer to my German bank account but any fees charged must be covered by you.
If you buy more games, then I make all in one package!
We have a large private collection of games. Due to space and time constraints we must rid ourselves of some of the games. Therefore, these are private sales.

boardgame.name: 4 aus Acht
boardgame.description: Which ingredients belong in a tiramisu? Or which countries have the highest per head cheese consumption? There are eight possible answers to each question, but only four of them are correct. Everyone plays the game as a team. Who has the right knowledge and finds 4 out of eight?

boardgame.name: All About Animals
boardgame.description:
Does the Alpine marmot weigh more than 20 kilos? And does the pink flamingo live in Africa? This quiz game is all about 200 large and small animals from all over the world. The players' knowledge is put to the test in 12 categories. The players can also reach the goal with good estimation skills and courageous steps.
Lots of fun is guaranteed here!

boardgame.name: Black Stories: Leichen, Pech & Pannen Edition
boardgame.description:
Deadly football goals, human stew in the Jacuzzi, exotic delicacies that bite back without further ado: incomprehensible accidents, catastrophic coincidences and dramatic passing ...
The Grim Reaper is never at a loss for ideas when it comes to decimating his flock. And reality still invents the darkest stories!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

boardgame.name: Black Stories: Vorsicht, Verschwörung!
boardgame.description:
In the bizarre world of conspiracy myths, nothing is too far-fetched not to be claimed.
For conspiracy theorists, everything is connected to everything else and nothing happens without a reason. But be careful: For those who believe such things will be in for a huge blow in these brand-new black stories!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

boardgame.name: Island Alone
boardgame.description:
A roll&write game about survival on a deserted tropical island.
The game is designed for 1 to 4 players, age 8+ with an average game time is 20-30 minutes.

In each turn, the active player rolls 4 D6 dice and performs actions using the dice pool. The goal of the game is to perform the scenario. For example: escape from the island, survive a certain number of days, find all the treasures.

The biggest obstacle during the game is constantly decreasing level of food and water, when they run out the player starts losing health and can die. It is also possible to die at the hands of another player and various dangers on the island.

The game continues until the scenario is completed or all players die.

Game published in 'Print&Play' format first.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Old King's Crown
boardgame.description:
The Old King’s Crown is a game of card-driven conquest, where you play as heirs to a vacant throne, vying for control of an ancient, overgrown kingdom. Wield unique abilities and leverage your followers’ traits to best outwit your opponents across a map that stretches from the teetering heights of the castle to the dappled light of the necropolis.

As leader of your faction you will be staking claims with Heralds openly as well as positioning your forces in secret, hoping to claim the locations that fit your designs. However, keep an eye on your rivals, as they too have agents and agendas, poised to undo your best laid plans.

Royalty, rebels or ruses. What crown will you wear?

In The Old King's Crown, players move their Herald to locations, hoping to claim them. Then simultaneously players play cards from their hand, facedown to regions of the board. These are then revealed and resolved. Winning these clashes will result in different rewards that further their position and grant them the game's primary goal, influence. When a player is able to reach a set number of influence, dependent on player count, and is able to retain it until the end of a round, they win the game.

boardgame.name: Fingerlings: Treetop Fall Game
boardgame.description:
You're good at keeping your Fingerlings on your finger, but can you keep them from falling out of the tree in the new Fingerlings Treetop Fall Game?

This is a classic skill-and-action game where players take turns pulling branches out of the tree without letting any of the monkey pieces inside the tree fall out. You've got to spin the spinner to find out what color branch you should remove, or maybe you'll get lucky and spin the skip space so you don't have to remove any branch that turn. If any monkeys fall to the bottom of the tree on your turn, you keep them. Once all the monkeys have fallen out of the tree, the game ends and the player with the fewest monkeys wins.

boardgame.name: Ark Nova: Eurohell Design Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert, can be stored vertically and is safe for transport

No long search for the unique buildings, but directly clearly arranged on the table.

Card tray anti-slip for sleeves and stylish in card color.

Tile tray with lid, put on the table and start playing.

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Eurohell Design Organizer
boardgame.description:
Insert, can be stored vertically and is safe for transport.

Atmospheric goods trays spoke neutral with symbols on bottom and under clampable lids.

Cool card trays prevent sleeved stacks of cards from fanning out or falling over.

Guardians and locations also have a tray that fits directly onto the board.

Temple tiles can be adjusted to the number of players.

boardgame.name: AuZtralia: Promo Packet 1
boardgame.description:
AuZtralia Promo Pack 1 released for the Kickstarter campaign for the AuZtralia expansions: TaZmania and Revenge of the Old Ones.

Includes new Mythos cards and Helper cards to be used with the base game:

3 new Mythos cards: Cthulhu, Bokrug, Nightgaunt
3 new Solo Mythos cards: Cthulhu, Bokrug, Nightgaunt
10 Helper cards: "Buddy" Budowski, Florence Poison, Elsa Ware, Lord Switchener, Iron Horse Bob, Charles Grey, Captain Rex Porter, Doctor Anton Phibes, Doctor Herbert Combs, and Emily Earhart

The new Mythos cards share the same character names but have slightly different abilities depending on if it's a solo or a regular game:

different points (solo: next to card name, regular: upper left corner),
different backs, and
different rules or text (Nightgaunt is about stealing from another player for 5 turns in the regular game, and in the solo game it's about losing a personality card for 5 turn; and Bokrug and Cthulhu have similar rules between the regular and solo games).

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Super Fantasy Brawl: Various plastic tokens
boardgame.description: Replaces all cardboard token.

boardgame.name: Super Fantasy Brawl: The Wizards Statues
boardgame.description:
Honouring three of the greatest Wizards ever to bring a team of Champions to the Super Brawl arena, these three also work their magic on your game experience too by replacing the flat 2D pillars with these highly-detailed 3D terrain pieces.

Ragryl is the oldest of the Brawl creators, steeped in ancient lore and old magics. Hailed as one of the finest minds throughout time, he is most closely aligned to the Creation aspect of the Three Cores.

Esmae's looming statue shows her mastery of magic, casting her gaze over the arena, reaching into every possible and conceivable future to determine what should come to pass. Floating above the symbol of Manipulation, Esmae radiates confidence and power as she presides over the Super Brawl!

Garnet stands proudly in the centre of the arena, challenging Champions of the Brawl to step into the ‘danger zone' of the Destruction area, where the elements of Destruction are his to command.

boardgame.name: Hoffer
boardgame.description:
Hoffer is a precision bidding card game for 2 - 4 players. In this game, players will simultaneously bid on how many tricks they will capture. Accuracy is key as players who hit their bid will earn the most points.

Players wrestle with changing hand sizes, Jacks that move up in rank, and Jokers that automatically win or lose the trick. With the use of a tight 26 card deck, the Bower system borrowed from Euchre, and two Jokers, players will scramble for points as they travel up and down the river.

Whoever has the most points at the end of the final round wins the game.

boardgame.name: Elerion: het bordspel
boardgame.description: In this narrative adventure game, players must work together as they slog through cities, wilderness, dungeons and caves. However, watch out for the hidden agendas of fellow players. The characters that survive the game can come back in the next adventure and you can even string together a whole series of scenarios. There is even the option to write new screenplays yourself. The future is uncertain!

boardgame.name: Alieninjas
boardgame.description: These space beings escaped from a Laboratory and, with their ability to transform, easily infiltrated humans, but they are unable to camouflage themselves completely, leaving some peculiarities on display. You and your friends are special agents who must identify and capture these beings in 5 super fun games where speed and intelligence will make all the difference!

boardgame.name: Absolutely Stonkers!
boardgame.description:
Absolutely Stonkers! is an easy to learn strategic card game that was born out of the 2021 meme stock mania which took the world by storm. The game is fast-paced, funny, and has two ways to win.

Players draw and discard cards to collect stocks and stopother players from colleecting them. Be the first to collect a Stonk (stock) card from each of the seven industries or the last one standing after all the other players have been indicted by the SEC to win. There are plenty of ways to sabotage other players and evade the SEC while on the way to become a Stonk Titan.

boardgame.name: Fatum Blank Cards Expansion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb]

Customize your own card, drawing, writing or sticking any image on it!

4 class blank cards
4 personality blank cards
4 background blank cards
4 bonds blank cards
4 events blank cards
4 places blank cards
4 races blank cards

boardgame.name: Fatum Following the light/Stepping into the Darkness Promo
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb]

Special card with gold foil ink. Compatible with all FATUM cards.

boardgame.name: Fatum Legendary Hero Promo
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Gold foil card issued as part of the first kickstarter.

boardgame.name: Happy Little Dinosaurs: Dating Disasters
boardgame.description:
The only thing worse than a falling meteor? A first date.

In this 54-card expansion pack, you might dodge the dreaded friendzone, encounter a giant catfish, or go out with a dino who says “I love you” way too early. Awkward...

Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
